Shelter : My Sweet HomeUnit–III : Our Needs
8
A house is a shelt er wher e we live. We feel safe and secur e in a house. We need 
house for man y reasons :
Ÿ It protects us from heat, cold, strong winds and rain.
Ÿ It also protects us from thieves and wild animals.
Ÿ We can keep our things like clothes, utensils, eatables and jeweller y 
safely in a house.
Ÿ We enjo y comfort in a house.! Write the c omple te addr ess of y our house.
 ___________________________________________________________
! Why do w e need a house?
 ___________________________________________________________Starter
"There is no place 
like a home."
Ther e are mainly two types of houses –
 1. Kutcha House 2.    Pucc a HouseTypes of Houses
Environmental Studies-355Let’sKNOW Let’sKNOW

Kutcha House
A Kutcha house is a tempor ary house. It is made up 
of straw, mud, bamboo , leaves etc. Mos tly these 
houses are found in the villag es. Mos t of them are 
build in the shape of a hut.
Pucca House
A pucc a house is a permanen t house. It is made up of 
brick s wood, iron, cemen t, marble, tiles etc. Such 
houses are found in towns and cities.
In big cities, there are very big houses called 
bunglo ws. Ther e is a pr oblem of space in big cities so 
flats are also made in multi-s toreyed buildings. A flat is 
a pucc a house and has all comforts.
Other House
3. Tent houses–  Tent houses are tempor ary houses 
made of canvas or nylon. They are used by 
campers, soldiers or mountaineers. These 
houses can be pack ed up and taken to other 
places.2. Houseboats– Houseboats are floating 
houses that are built on boats. Such houses 
are found in Dal Lake in Kashmir and in 
backw aters of Kerala.1. Igloos–  Igloos are houses made of ice-
blocks. They are found in Greenland. 
Eskimos live in igloos. It keeps them warm 
in very cold weather.
Kutcha House 
Pucca House 
Igloo
Houseboats
Tent House
Environmental Studies-3 56

5. Stilt houses– In Assam, people build 
houses on stilts. These houses keep them 
safe from wild animals and floods. The 
stilts allow the water to pass from belo w 
the houses.4. Caravans–  People who move from place to 
place, build their houses on wheels. These 
houses are called caravans.
Characteristics of a good house
Ther e are certain features of a good house–
! It allows proper sunligh t which kills germs.
! It has enough windo ws and ventilators to allow proper ventilation. Air keeps 
house fresh and free from suffocation.
! It has a good drainag e system.
! The door s and windo ws of a good house have wire-mesh to keep mosquit oes 
and flies away.
! It has clean and green surroundings.
! The floor of its kitchen and bathroom are sloping so that water can flow out 
easily .
! All the drains are covered.
! It has separ ate rooms for cooking , eating, sleeping , studying etc.
! It is neat and tidy.
Houses in earthquake prone areas are made of wood because such 
houses do not break off easily. They are flexible also. Such houses are 
found in Himachal Pradesh and Kerala.Caravans
Stilt House
You  Know Must (Knowledge )
Environmental Studies-357

A neat and tidy house
A house should be kept clean and tidy. We should follow certain golden rules to 
keep our house clean and tidy.
These are  :
! Do not scatter things around.
! Put the things after use at their proper places.
! Throw garbag e in dustbins only.
! Keep the washr ooms dry and clean.
! Floor s should be swept and mopped daily .
! Help each other to keep the house clean.
Garbage Disposal
It is very import ant to remo ve the garbag e 
from our homes daily . Some people clean 
their houses and emp ty their dustbins on 
the street creating garbag e heap s. These 
garbag e heap s become a breeding ground 
for germs, flies and mosquit oes which may 
cause man y diseases.
Composting Recycling
Green bin Blue bin
Segregation of waste in bins
A safe disposal of garba ge creates a clean and health y environmen t.All household waste should be thrown in bins. We should sort the waste in two 
parts. One part is of vegetables, fruit peels, egg shells and left over food. This kind 
of waste should be put into a green bin. The other part is of plastic, metal, glass and 
paper waste which should be put into a blue bin.
You  Know Must (Environmen tal lit eracy)
Key termsKey termsKey terms
! Garbag e – Waste material.
! Disposal– The process of getting rid of some thing.
Environmental Studies-3 58

Environmental Studies-361

Clothes : A B asic NeedUnit–III : Our Needs
9
! Tick ( 3) the type of clothes tha t you lik e the mos t.
! Why do w e wear clothes?
Food, shelt er and clothing are the basic human needs. We need clothes to 
cover our body . Clothes protect us from heat, rain, cold and insects. Apart 
from this, clothing inhances our personality. When we wear neat ad 
comfortable clothes, we feel good and confiden t.Starter
Types of clothes
We wear different type of clothes according to season, occasion or profession. 
Thus, clothes are divided into three categories–
 1. Protectiv e clothes (Seasonal clothes)
 2. Decorative clothes (Occ asional clothes)
 3. Uniform (Special job clothes)
 Protectiv e clothes– We wear light cotton clothes in 
summers. Cotton clothes keep us cool and absorb sweat. They are soft 
comfortable and airy. Punjabi
ClothesKashmiri
ClothesHaryanavi
ClothesRajasthani
Clothes
Cotton Clothes
Environmental Studies-3 62
Let’sKNOW Let’sKNOW

MarriageIn winters, we wear woollen clothes. Woollen clothes 
keep us warm by trapping the heat of our body .
Woollen Clothes
In the r ainy season, w e wear r aincoats over our 
clothes to avoid getting wet.
Rainy Clothes
Decor ative clothes–  Brigh t, colourful and fancy dresses are worn at happy 
occasions such as marriag es, birthda y parties, anniv ersaries, religious festivals etc. 
These dresses are specially designed for these occasions.
Birthday par ty Diwali
Unif orm–  Some people's clothes tell us about the type of job they do. We can 
easily iden tify policemen or soldier s by their uniform. A doct or wears a whit e coat 
while a lawyer wears a black coat. Such special type of clothes are called uniforms. 
Each school has a different uniform for its studen ts.
Doctor Soldier Policeman Student
Environmental Studies-363

Traditional Clothes
People wear various kinds of clothes according to the tradition of the place wher e 
they live. In different parts of India people wear different kinds of clothes.
! Women of Punjab wear salw ar-kamee z and Dupa tta.
! Woman of Kashmir wear long , loose woollen coat called Phiran.
! Women in Haryana wear Ghagr a-kurta.
! Women in Rajas than wear Ghagr a-choli.
Haryana Rajasthan Punjab Kashmir
How are clothes made?
Clothes are made up of thin threads called fibres. Fibres are of two types–
 1. Natural fibres 2. Synthetic fibres
1. Natural Fibres– Fibres that we get from plan ts and animals are called natural 
fibres. Some natural fibres are–
 (a) Cotton– Cotton fibre is obtained from cotton plan t.
 (b) Wool– Wool fibre is obtained from the fur of sheep, goat, yak etc.
 (c) Jute– Jute fibre is obtained from jute plan t.
 (d) Silk– Silk fibre is obtained from silk worms which feed on mulberr y leaves.
2. Synthetic Fibres– Some fibres are prepar ed by men in the factories. Such fibres 
are called synthetic fibres. These fibres are made from coal, petroleum and 
other chemic als. They are light, strong and cheap. Some synthetic fibres are – 
Nylon, rayon, poly ester etc.
Environmental Studies-3 64
Taking care of clothes
It is essen tial for everyone to take care of their clothes because good clothes mak e 
us feel good and confiden t.
Few poin t that you should follow about your clothes are–

Ÿ Clothes protect us form heat, cold, rain and insects.
Ÿ Clothes mak e us feel good and confiden t.
Ÿ We wear different clothes for different seasons and occasions.
Ÿ People who do special jobs wear special kinds of clothes called uniforms.
Ÿ Natural fibres are obtained form plan ts and animals. 
Ÿ Synthetic fibres are prepar ed by chemic als in the factories.

Means of Transport10
Starter
The movemen ts of people and goods from one place to another is called transport. 
People move from one place to another for different reasons. They go to their places 
of work, to their relatives or for some other purposes. Childr en go to school. The 
movemen t of people from one place to another over a long distance is called 
travelling.
For travelling we can use a car, bus, train, ship or an aeroplane. All these vehicles are 
called means of transport.
Different Means of T ransport! How do you go to your 
school?
! How do you travel to your 
Early man used various types of animals for riding and carrying load. After the 
invention of wheel different vehicles have been made. The different means of 
transport in presen t time are–
 Land T ransport             W ater Transport                     Air T ransportUnit–III : Our Needs
Let’sKNOW Let’sKNOW
Land T ransport
The vehicles that move on land are called means of land transport. Examples of 
land transport are – Buses, bikes, truck s, scooters, auto-rick shaws, trains, cycles, 
tongas etc. Land transport is the mos t commonly used means of transport. It is less 
Environmental Studies-3 68

Camel is called the ship of the desert.
Water transport is the cheapes t and slowest means of transport. 
Some examples are– Boats, motorboa ts, steamer s and ships. 
Ship s take us across the seas and transport huge quan tities of 
goods such as grains, industrial products and oil to other 
countries.  Boats carry us across rivers and lakes.Water T ransportTrain Bus Truck Bike
You  Know Must (Knowledge )
Bullock car t Camel car t
 Tongaexpensiv e and has better connectivity . In metro cities people travel by metro rails, 
bikes and cars etc. In villag es, people use bullock -carts, tractors, tongas, bicycles 
etc. People living in hilly areas use ponies and mules. In deserts, people use camels 
to transport people and goods.
Ship
Cruise ship s are luxury ships that carry man y people across the seas for a vacation.
Submarines are warships that move under water.
Ship s which carry good are called Cargo ship s.You  Know Must (Knowledge )
Environmental Studies-369

Air transport is the fastest and the mos t expensiv e 
means of transport. Examples of air transport are– 
Aeroplanes, helic opters, hot-air balloons and rockets.Air Transport
Ther e are man y special kinds of vehicles that are used for a particular purpose. 
Some of them are–
! Ambulance– An ambulance is a vehicle that is used to carry sick people to and 
from the  hospit al.
! Police Van– It carries the police to different places to main tain law and order.
! Fire Engine– It is a special type of van that help s to put out fires.
! Mail Van– A mail van carries letters and posts to and from a post office.
! Ice cream Cart– It is a special type of vehicle that has ice inside to keep the ice 
cream cold so that it does not melt.Special V ehicles
! The various means of transport have helped human a lot but they cause air and 
noise pollution.
! Fuel takes millions of years to get formed. Over use of fuels may lead to their 
exhaus tion.Effects of Means of T ransport
Aeroplane
We mus t walk short distances or use a bicycle. It keeps us health y, saves 
fuel and protects the environmen t.
! Transport – System of carrying people or goods from one place to another .
! Steamer  – A boat or ship driven by steam.
! Fuel – Anything that is burned to produce heat or pow er.You  Do Must (Knowledge )
Key termsKey termsKey terms
Environmental Studies-3 70
